intro: Amphipterygium adstringens subsp. simplicifolium, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a short, thick stem with dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are fleshy, ovate, and often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. This subspecies is notable for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
